reference.shortdesc: The troubleshooting element is the top-level element for a troubleshooting topic.Should make this consistent with other topic specialization elements, which state that they are topics and list the purpose, rather than simply describing them as a top-level element.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: Troubleshooting topics begin with a description of a condition that the reader might want to correct, followed by one or more cause-remedy pairs. Each cause-remedy pair is a potential solution to the trouble described in the condition. Troubleshooting topics represent the kind of information that users typically consult to fix a problem.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The troubleshooting element is specialized from topic. It is defined in the troubleshooting module.

example.title: Example
example.codeblock:
E247 - Memory fault has occured The system has detected a problem in memory.

The fault indicator flashes on the front panel, and the error log contains the following message: E247 - Memory fault has occured

Transient memory fault.

 System administrator Reset the alarm Monitor the system periodically to see whether the alarm recurs

Recurring memory fault indicates possible problem with the system memory board. Reseating the board may fix the problem.

 Maintenance technician

Reseating the system memory board did not fix the problem. Replacing the board may fix the problem.
